titlestmt.titleproper: Central Building Saving and Loan Association official minutes book 1868-1875
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Central Building Saving and Loan Association official minutes book
did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: The Central Building Saving & Loan Association was founded in Philadelphia in 1868. William Wallace was the Association's secretary.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a volume of monthly minutes of the Association for 1868 to 1869. The minutes document such activities as the recommendation of loans, withdrawals of investments by shareholders, and resignations of board members. The first page of the volume is a financial report submitted to the board, which lists subscribers, stockholders, receipts, and capital.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

acqinfo.p: Provenance: Gift of the Moyerman family.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Historical Society of Pennsylvania: Central Building and Saving Loan Association of Philadelphia constitution and minutes. (Amb .197 folio)
